definitions.definition: the period of time when somebody holds an important job, especially a political one; the act of holding an important job

examples.text: She had a long tenure of office.

definitions.definition: the right to stay permanently in your job, especially as a teacher at a university

examples.text: It's still extremely difficult to get tenure.
She has been granted tenure at Leeds University.

definitions.definition: the legal right to live in a house or use a piece of land

examples.text: When you rent a house here, you don’t have security of tenure.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old French, from tenir ‘to hold’, from Latin tenere.
